Another thing to consider is whether the enemy might move towards me. But since I don't have information about the enemy's last move or AI, I can't predict its movement. So I should assume it might try to intercept me if I get too close.

So I have to be careful not to step into (4,3) or any of the enemy's body parts, but since the enemy's body is empty, it's only the head.

But moving down from (2,5) to (2,4) is moving towards the enemy's y-coordinate. The enemy is at (4,3), so (2,4) is two units left and one unit up from the enemy.
